meanings.definition: The quality of being cheap or tasteless in appearance or style.
meanings.sent1: The tackiness of the decorations made the room look unattractive.
meanings.sent2: The store's products were known for their tackiness, with bright colors and excessive glitter.
meanings.sent3: The tackiness of the outfit was so extreme that it became a fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: Her taste in interior design was impeccable, always avoiding any hint of tackiness.
meanings.sent5: The tackiness of the paint job made the car stand out in a negative way.

meanings.definition: The stickiness or adhesive quality of a surface.
meanings.sent1: The tackiness of the tape made it easy to stick things together.
meanings.sent2: The tackiness of the glue ensured the papers stayed in place.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the tackiness of the stickers made them impossible to remove.
meanings.sent4: The tackiness of the new labels made them perfect for sealing envelopes.
meanings.sent5: The tackiness of the floor made it difficult to walk without shoes.

meanings.definition: The act of attaching or fastening something with tacks or nails.
meanings.sent1: The tackiness of the tacks made it easy to secure the posters on the wall.
meanings.sent2: He demonstrated the tackiness of the nails by hanging a heavy frame effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The tackiness of the hammer made it simple to nail the boards together.
meanings.sent4: She admired the tackiness of the stapler as it neatly fastened the papers.
meanings.sent5: The tackiness of the thumbtacks made them ideal for pinning notes on the bulletin board.
